Package javelin.controller.terrain

Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.terrain.Terrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Desert, Forest, Hill, Marsh, Mountains, Plains, Underground, Water
    public abstract class Terrain
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Represent different types of World terrain. One of the responsibilities of subclasses is to generate World areas. The world generation method is pretty arbitrary, though it's based on real-life geological considerations (like which area is usually close or distant to each area) but not too worried with realist. Read the documentation for methods starting with generate- for more information. Each terrain also offer hazards and events, which occur about 1% of the step, but are only really triggered if conditions are right.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        current - The last expanded point for this area.
        Returns:
        the source, by default. Subclasses may change this behavior.

      • gethazards

        public java.util.Set<Hazard> gethazards​(boolean special)
        Hazards are things like a sandstorm in a Desert or a storm in Water, which can have dire implication for a Squad travelling in that terrain, Somewhat of a misnomer, a hazard can also be a more peaceful event like meeting a special character or such. Almost all types of hazards are dependent upon Season, Weather and day period conditions. No one suffers a heatstroke on the desert during the night, for example. Usually, even if the conditions for multiple types of hazards are met in a certain time period, only one of them should actually trigger.
        Parameters:
        special - true if may allow a special event to happen. Special events are rare occurances like a spontaneous avalanche.
        Returns:
        See Also:
        HAZARDCHANCE, Javelin.getDayPeriod(), WorldMove

      • getweather

        public java.lang.String getweather()
        Returns:
        a string representation of the Weather.
        See Also:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getmonsters
